column1: The Kings of Rhudaur were the hereditary rulers of Rhudaur

The first king of Rhudaur was the third and youngest son of Eärendur (King of Arnor) who following his fathers death in  disputed the ascension of his elder brother Amlaith to the throne and declared himself king of an independent realm.
Rhudaur itself was the most isolated and inhospitable of the northern kingdoms
column2: and it would seem that a significant number of the kings subjects were native Hill-men who resented rule by Númenóreans. At some point after The date of the foundation of Angmar this group
column4: usurped the throne of Rhudaur and drove out the Dúnedain. The usurped dynasty
column6: presumably sought refuge in Arthedain or Cardolan.
